subject: RE: [junit] Testing GUIs - mouse clicks, list selections, and oth	er user inputs

messageBody:
Jemmy (http://jemmy.netbeans.org) provides some gui testing utilities
(searching for components, simulating user actions, ...). I haven't had a
change to really play with it, but it doesn't look hard to use w/ junit.

--- tumb@... wrote:
>
> Can someone give me some references to how JUnit can
> be used to test
> GUIs? All the examples I've seen test class fields,
> computations, etc.
>
> How do I test things that depend on mouse clicks and
> screen visuals such
> as:
>
> When I click on the column header 'Last Name' do the
> rows in the table
> sort in alphabetic order? And do the first names
> stay with the proper
> last name?
>
> When my combo box selects 'animals' does the panel
> next to it fill with a
> list of animals?
>
> In my text editor, does the button for bold text go
> down when the user
> selects a piece of text in the editor that is bold?
>
> In my drawing progam, when I select red does the
> active line turn red?
> Does the next shape I draw come in red?
>
> If there's a book or two on the subject that would
> be ideal. If not, how
> about some web sites with tutorials.
>
>
> On Tue, 26 Feb 2002 16:45:44 +0100 Mark Meyers
> <markm@...> writes:
> > Might be a variation on the age old classloader
> problem.
> > (reloaded classes are different classes)
> > Try adding "excluded.6=org.*" to your
> > junit/runner/excluded.properties file
> >
> >
